intro: Tritonia mathewsiana, commonly known as the Mathews' bellflower, is a species of flowering plant native to the island of Mauritius. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its leaves are elliptical and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and often branched. Tritonia mathewsiana is considered a rare and endangered species due to habitat loss and limited distribution.
